name: Hebe Shrub
climate: Hebe shrubs thrive in temperate climates with mild winters and cool summers.
They prefer climates where temperatures are consistently moderate throughout the year.
Avoid regions with extreme cold or excessively hot and dry conditions.
Hebe shrubs can tolerate some frost but excessive cold can damage them.
sunlight: These plants thrive best in full sun to partial shade, allowing for optimal growth.
In very hot climates, some afternoon shade can help protect them from overheating.
While they can tolerate partial shade, too much shade may reduce blooming.
Position Hebe shrubs in a location where they can receive at least six hours of sunlight.
watering: Hebe shrubs require regular watering, especially during dry spells or summer months.
Ensure the soil remains moist but not waterlogged to promote healthy growth.
During winter, watering can be reduced as the plantâ€™s water needs are lower.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so good drainage is essential.
soil: Well-draining soil is crucial to prevent waterlogging and root rot in Hebe shrubs.
A sandy loam that retains some moisture but drains efficiently is ideal.
Soil pH should be neutral to slightly acidic to suit Hebe shrub needs.
Compacted or clay-heavy soils should be amended with organic matter for aeration.
toxic: Hebe shrubs are generally non-toxic and are considered safe for pets and humans.
extra_care_tip: Prune Hebe shrubs after flowering to maintain shape and encourage new blooms.
Mulching around the plant base helps retain soil moisture and improves health.
